Simple answer: Yes it doesâ€¦ :-) (It is a great toolkit, thanks Roman!)

I have used in a couple of fairly simple DSL parsing projects, but am currently using it in a full-blown language addition to Mono.

I just posted a pull request for my Gtk# version of the Grammar Explorer @

https://irony.codeplex.com/SourceControl/network/forks/Sushihangover/Irony/contribution/5702

I also posted a simple pull request to fix a NUnit test that fails under OS-X/*nix @

https://irony.codeplex.com/SourceControl/network/forks/Sushihangover/Irony/contribution/5701

Screen shot : http://sushihangover.azurewebsites.net/post/Irony-Grammar-Explorer-GTK-Edition-Beta-posted

This is a 'quickie' under GTK, but it is fully featured when compared to the WinForms version, would love some other people to test and posting of any issues found.

-Robert

thanks, looks great! will get to it as soon as I can, on weekend hopefully.
Roman
